SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.tui.printers

Class PrintCard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.view.tui.printers.PrintCard
public class PrintCard extends Object
This printer contains all methods to transform a ViewCard into its String[5] representation
It also contains some methods to manipulate or print String[5] representations as needed.

  • Method Details

    • getSpaces

      public String getSpaces(int length)
      Returns a string composed of 'length' spaces, empty if length is less than zero.
      Parameters:
      length - number of spaces to return
      Returns:
      a string composed of 'length' spaces, empty if length <= 0

    • getCardAsStringRows

      public String[] getCardAsStringRows(ViewCard card)
      Defaults getCardAsStringRows(ViewCard, hideID) to hideID = false
      Parameters:
      card - any ViewCard to be transformed in String[5] representation
      Returns:
      the Card's String[5] representation. An array of 5 strings top->bottom.
      Already colored and formatted with ANSI characters.

    • getCardAsStringRows

      public String[] getCardAsStringRows(ViewCard card, boolean hideID)
      This method delegates the creation of the String[5] representation to the specific (private) implementation of getCardAsStringRows for the effective type of the card.
      Parameters:
      card - any ViewCard to be transformed in String[5] representation. A null value is interpreted as an "empty" card.
      hideID - true if the card's ID digits should be hidden (only the letter would be shown).
      Returns:
      the Card's String[5] representation. An array of 5 strings top->bottom.
      Already colored and formatted with ANSI characters.
      A null card (empty) is transformed into 5 rows of spaces with the same display length as non-null cards, to be printed alongside other non-null cards.
      *Please note* that the corners of a null card are still colored as normal corners and should be processed by cutAllCornersIfEmpty(String[5]) to be replaced by spaces with no coloring.

    • printCard

      public void printCard(ViewCard card)
      Prints any ViewCard on System.out in its String[5] representation.
      Parameters:
      card - the ViewCard to print

    • printCardsSideBySide

      public void printCardsSideBySide(List<String[]> cardsAsStringRows, int cardSpacing)
      Prints a list of ViewCards on System.out in their String[5] representation.
      The cards are printed in a row left -> right in the order they are in the List
      Parameters:
      cardsAsStringRows - the ViewCards to print
      cardSpacing - the spacing between printed cards

    • cutAllCornersIfEmpty

      public String[] cutAllCornersIfEmpty(String[] cardAsStringRows)
      Returns the unchanged cardAsStringRows if it wasn't a null card's String[5] representation.
      Otherwise, returns a String[5] of just spaces with no coloring.
      Parameters:
      cardAsStringRows - any ViewCard's String[5] representation, even a null card's
      Returns:
      the unchanged cardAsStringRows if it wasn't a null card's String[5] representation.
      Otherwise, returns a String[5] of just spaces with no coloring.
